se450.elevator

Class ElevatorImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • se450.elevator.ElevatorImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Elevator

    public class ElevatorImpl
extends java.lang.Thread
implements Elevator
    The implementation of Elevator interface. It also extends Thread class. It contains the most important logic for elevator movement.
    Author:
    Shan Gao

    • Constructor Detail

      • ElevatorImpl

        public ElevatorImpl(int elevatorID,
                    int maxPassenger,
                    int maxFloor,
                    int timePerFloor,
                    int timePerDoorOp,
                    int defaultFloor,
                    int timeOut)
             throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Constructor of Elevator. Need to input default parameters of this Elevator instance;
        Parameters:
        elevatorID - - The id of this elevator, int.
        maxPassenger - - Max capacity of this elevator, int.
        maxFloor - - Max floor of this elevator will go, int.
        timePerFloor - - How long does this elevator spend per go UP/DOWN 1 floor. Millisecond, int.
        timePerDoorOp - - How long does this elevator spend per door open and then close. Millisecond, int.
        defaultFloor - - Default floor of this elevator, int.
        timeOut - - If this elevator idles longer than this time, it will go to the defaultFloor. Millisecond, int.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:

      • requestList_toString

        public java.lang.String requestList_toString()
        This method will walk through the request list and return a string for print purpose
        Returns:
        - The current request list with format [Floor Requests: ...] [Rider Requests: ...]

      • distance

        public int distance(Request request)
        Calculate the distance of a request to the elevator based on the current elevator moving direction. This method includes the most important logic to sort request array.
        Parameters:
        request - - The request to be calculated.
        Returns:
        - The number of floors elevator need to go to answer the request.

      • isNearer

        public int isNearer(Request r1,
                    Request r2)
        Compare two requests determine which is nearer to current floor based on the current elevator moving direction.
        Parameters:
        r1 - - Request 1.
        r2 - - Request 2.
        Returns:
        - 1 if request 1 is nearer, 0 if request 1 is same far as request 2. -1 if request 1 is farer.

      • addRequest

        public void addRequest(Request request)
                throws java.security.InvalidParameterException
        Add the request to the request list.
        Specified by:
        addRequest in interface Elevator
        Parameters:
        request - - The request to be added.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidParameterException

      • notifyRequestList

        public void notifyRequestList(boolean checkRequestSize)
        Notify after the request list has been changed, such that 'wait' function in run function will stop waiting.
        Parameters:
        checkRequestSize - - true, then notify only when requestList.size() is larger than 0. false, notify without checking the size of requestList.

      • notifyForTimeOut

        public void notifyForTimeOut()
        Notify by timeout action.

      • halt

        public void halt()

      • isAvailableForRequest

        public boolean isAvailableForRequest(Request request)

      • isAvailableForRequest

        public boolean isAvailableForRequest(Request request,
                                     boolean fromPendingList)
        Check if the elevator is available for the request.
        Parameters:
        request - - The specific request.
        fromPendingList - - 1) Add as initial request if no request in the elevator request list. 2) NextRequest.direction = InitialRequest.direction 3) NextRequest.floor - InitialRequest.floor = InitialRequest.direction.
        Returns:
        true - This elevator can respond the request. false - This elevator can't respond the request.

      • calculateWaitingTimeForRequest

        public long calculateWaitingTimeForRequest(Request request)
        Calculate waiting time for the request. Consider 2 factors: 1) Traveling time: Associated with distance. 2) Operation time: Open/close door for each stop.
        Parameters:
        request - - The specific request.
        Returns:
        The calculated waiting time.

      • onArriveAtFloor

        public void onArriveAtFloor(int currentFloor)
        Operations when the elevator arrives at a new floor.
        Parameters:
        currentFloor - - The floor which the elevator has arrived at.

      • printElevatorIsFull

        public void printElevatorIsFull(Request r)
        Elevator is already full, request will be added to pending list.
        Parameters:
        r - - The new request that will be added to pending list.

      • isIdle

        public boolean isIdle()
        Check if the elevator is idle.
        Returns:
        true - The elevator is idle. false - The elevator isn't idle.

      • isTimeOut

        public boolean isTimeOut()
        Check if the elevator is timeout.
        Returns:
        true - The elevator is timeout. false - The elevator isn't timeout.
